title: Passenger arrested for opening plane door mid-flight over South Korea
description: In footage that appeared to have been captured by a passenger, wind could be seen whipping into the plane’s cabin, battering passengers.

title: FBI files reveal 1983 threat to kill Queen Elizabeth II during U.S. visit
description: The 102 pages of FBI files reveal threats linked to Queen Elizabeth II's visits to the U.S., including the 1983 visit where she was hosted by Ronald Reagan.

title: China and Russia have promised to boost trade. Can they?
description: Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin visited China promising increased trade, but beyond energy and machinery, the scope may be limited.

title: Israeli agents conducted targeted killings in civilian area, killing a child
description: A 3D reconstruction by The Washington Post captures the increasingly deadly tactics used by Israeli forces during raids in the occupied West Bank.

title: India’s northeast racked by ethnic unrest partly fueled by Myanmar crisis
description: The flow of refugees from Myanmar after the coup has inflamed longstanding ethnic tensions in the Indian state of Manipur.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Europe to run F-16 training for Kyiv; Bakhmut handover to Russian military underway, Wagner says
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said Denmark and the Netherlands will lead the European coalition providing Ukraine with F-16 pilot training and maintenance.

title: Amid Turkey election, a Syrian man’s murder stokes fear among refugees
description: After a campaign marked by anti-immigrant appeals, Syrian refugees worry their fate is on the ballot when Turks go the polls in Sunday's runoff election.

title: Sunny weather in southern Ukraine suggests new fighting season has begun
description: With Ukrainian soldiers wearing warm-weather uniforms, a much-anticipated counterattack against occupying Russian forces seems imminent.

title: China and Russia draw closer, but how close?
description: While Russia wants to make good on its supposed “no limits” friendship with Beijing, Chinese officials and analysts describe the ties between the countries as not a full-fledged alliance.
